intro: Tridactyle polychista, commonly known as the common sea holly, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers and spiny, leaf-like structures called bracts. This plant thrives in coastal environments, often found in rocky shores and tidal zones. Its reproductive strategy involves producing small, wind-dispersed seeds. The plant plays a vital role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems and providing habitat for various marine organisms.
